question: What is the new name of the Central Bank of Saudi Arabia, formerly known as Saudi Arabian Monetary Authority?
explanation:
Under a new law approved by the Saudi Arabia's King Salman bin Abdulaziz al-Saud, the Saudi Arabian Monetary Authority will be renamed to Saudi Central Bank.
However, the Central Bank will continue to use its acronym "SAMA" due to its historic significance and relevance. The new law also mandates the objectives of the Central Bank to maintain monetary stability, support economic growth and to directly report King of Saudi Arabia.
